snippet: For the first time, Microsoft is enabling SQL Server, its software for managing business data, to run on a competing operating system.
abstract: Microsoft says SQL Server, its software for managing corporate data, will run on Linux; marks shift away from Windows-only policy that could soon involve other Microsoft products.
lead_paragraph: For the first time, Microsoft is enabling SQL Server, its software for managing business data, to run on a competing operating system.

headline.main: Microsoft Opens Its Corporate Data Software to Linux
